intro: Alyssum cilicicum, commonly known as Cilician alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers throughout the growing season. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Alyssum cilicicum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
